result.execSummary:
The defendant Francisco J Chavez was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor [Modifiers: Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Waukesha County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes:
Defendant is NOT eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program and IS Eligible for Substance Abuse Program. Sentence credit of 7 days were granted if imposed.
Consecutive to: Case 14CM799
AS OF 4/08/2015: Extended supervision is amended to 4 months.

miscConds.notes:
Costs to be paid as a condition of probation.
DNA Surcharge and sample are waived.

No Contact with K.W.   Submit to an AODA assessment, follow through with any treatment, counseling.  No use or possession of alcohol or illegal drugs/drug paraphernalia. Comply with random urine screens.  Maintain absolute sobriety. No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription.
  If Probation/Extended Supervision is revoked and/or a prison term ordered, outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collections may include income assignment.

timeConds.notes: Commencing forthwith. Non-working hours. Release for standard conditions.

records.addlTxt: Review/Modification Requested/Recommended from Department of Corrections.
Informing the Department of Corrections that the Court will take no action on there request to amend the Judgment of Conviction.
Review/Modification Requested/Recommended from Department of Corrections.

Defendant Francisco J Chavez in court, in custody, with attorney Adam J. Schleis.   Michele W. Hulgaard appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Court orders the following:
- Total sentence: 1 year 3 months (Initial Confinement: 1 year, Extended Supervision: 3 months) STAYED.  Credit for 7 days if revoked.
- Defendant IS NOT eligible for Challenge Incarceration
- Defendant IS eligible for Substance Abuse Program
- 2 years Probation. 
- Court costs of $243.00 to be paid as a Condition of Probation
- DNA Surcharge waived.
- DNA Sample waived.
- Conditions of Probation:  Submit to an AODA assessment and follow through with any treatment/counseling.  Maintain absolute sobriety/Random UAs. No use or possession of alcohol/drug paraphernalia/drugs without a valid prescription.  No contact with K.W.

CONDITION TIME: 60 days - NON WORKING HOURS WITH STANDARD RELEASE CONDITIONS - To commence FORTHWITH.
Sentencing hearing on February 25, 2015 at 02:00 pm.
